creator: Redferntotherescue
title: Texture mapping in Pixlr
description: This project demonstrates how to use texture mapping in Pixlr to enhance a drawing by applying close-up images of textures like skin, hair, or leather to give it a more pictorial feel. This is achieved by cutting and pasting texture images onto the drawing, and adjusting opacity and shading.
steps: Scan your drawing and open it in Pixlr, or create a drawing directly in Pixlr using the pencil tool.

Open your texture images in Pixlr. You can photograph textures yourself or find high-resolution images online. Copy the texture image using the marquee tool (M) and Ctrl+C, then paste it (Ctrl+V) onto the drawing layer.

Use Free Transform (Ctrl+T or Edit>Free Transform) to resize and reshape the texture to fit the desired area on the drawing. Hold Shift while changing the shape to maintain the texture's proportions. Click outside the texture and select 'yes' to apply the transformation.

Reduce the layer opacity to around 60% to see the drawing underneath. Use the lasso tool to cut out the texture around the desired area. Press Delete to remove the excess texture. Restore the opacity to 100%.

Repeat the process with remaining textures, ensuring they follow the contours of the drawing. Create new layers for shadows using the multiply blend mode and for highlights using the screen blend mode. Use low opacity on multiple layers to create a better picture.
